title: 4.5 freezes qnap nas
body:
transferred from bug genie:
http://bugs.owncloud.org/thebuggenie/owncloud/issues/oc-1699

unable to reproduce without qnap nas.

description:
when initiating copy jobs (gui drag&drop, client sync, or just regular gui upload, regardless of file size), the server and entire nas may hang for minutes or hours!

in these cases, and as long as the nas monitor has not yet freezed, i can observe the cpu load going up to 100% and 1 to 2 apache processes starting, whereof one taking 150mb of memory (afaik, an apache process uses only 12 mb???)

unfortunately, this occurs only sporadically, so i have no clue how to approach the cause --- in other cases i've smoothly sync'ed 100s of megabytes without significant cpu or memory load!

update: i've just updated to 4.5 beta3 and sync'ed several 100m+ files (~3gb in total). seemed to work fine - no hangs, no freezes.

but now i observe ongoing high apache activity, even after having closed any oc gui and terminated all connected syncing clients. looks like the beta3 is busy with some background jobs? (owncloud is the only apache app on this server)

server: qnap ts-110 (800 mhz arm, 256 mb ram, maybe too weak for oc?) firmware 3.7.3 (brand new version w/ php 5.3.14); owncloud 4.5 beta2 resp. beta3 w/ sqlite3

client: osx 10.6.8 and 10.7.4 w/ firefox 15.0.1 browser and owncloud sync client 1.1.0beta1
